pros: Excellent place to work and enjoyed every minute there
cons: Not many cons to speak on honestly

review_title: Nice college but some employees did not treat co-workers well.
pros: Really good benefits and nice campus.
cons: Some co-workers did not treat well.

pros: Small, attractive campus accessible to Boston.
cons: Very low adjunct salary ($3800/per course) and most departments are too adjunct heavy with a ratio of 1:5 full-time faculty to adjuncts. Adjunct Responsibilities (meetings and trainings) are expected and no stipend is given for attending. The majority of students are not motivated, and many have severe learning disabilities. The school does not provide enough services for those students, so faculty are expected to fill in the gaps, which is difficult when not given info on the students as to their needs.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hyde Park, MA
pros: Tuition reimbursement, tuition exchange for dependents.  Holidays and Vacation
cons: Extremely low pay, must have a second job and can't afford to live in the city, micro-management, shady practices, and blatant disregard for work/life balance.

review_title: LOVED working in the Financial Aid Office
job_title: Financial Services Representative in Dedham, MA
pros: Room for advancement, proper training, pay increases regularly, great co-workers
cons: I didn't have any negative experiences here. Whenever parents or students were out of line, upper management immediately took action to ensure their employees felt comfortable and safe.

pros: Small school set on a lovely campus in Boston suburbs.
cons: Extremely dysfunctional and arrogant administration! Demonstrate age discrimination and disrespect for faculty. More interested in the facade than supporting faculty and educational endeavors. Students are accepted who, for the most part, would not get into another college. Standards are set low and many students drop out, take 5-6 years to graduate or faculty succumb to administrative pressure to pass them.

pros: Some supportive staff members and decent faculty members
cons: limited career resources and potential for future growth

pros: You really get to know your professors and I love the small community!
cons: There are no cons at all

pros: Friendly environment, some flexibility with hours
